Description: Body sherd from shoulder of North Ionian pottery oinochoe or neck-amphora; interior reserved with wheelmarks; exterior, thin pale slip: protome of a woman facing left, wearing a sleeved chiton, arm lifted; part of a large pendant lotus flower to the left; added red on one of the petals of the flower; below, thin ground line, reserved band and broader painted zone. Drill-hole in broken edge from sampling for clay analysis.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.666)
Jones 1986 / Greek and Cypriot Pottery: a Review of Scientific Studies (p.701, table 8.18, no.9)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
